Class DataBaseConn

  • java.lang.Object
    • DataBaseConn

  • public class DataBaseConn
extends java.lang.Object
    Class which performs a connection to a local database. It inserts into a pre-created table the full form of the examined url as well as the computer-path where the .html file of the url is saved.
    Author:
    Web Masters

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static void getConnectionData()
      This method's purpose is to ask the user of this app all the necessary information such as the Local database path or the log-in data in order to perform a connection to the database.
      private static java.lang.String getDatabasePath()
      Method which helps to get (in a graphic way) the right database path using regular expressions to check the path and if-else blocks to handle any possible errors.
      protected static java.lang.String getLink() 
      private static java.lang.String getPassword()
      Method which helps to get (in a graphic way) the password of the user using if-else blocks to handle any possible errors.
      protected static java.lang.String getPath() 
      private static java.lang.String getTableName()
      Method which helps to get (in a graphic way) the table's name using if-else blocks to handle any possible errors.
      private static java.lang.String getUsername()
      Method which helps to get (in a graphic way) the username of the user using if-else blocks to handle any possible errors.
      protected void insertData(java.util.HashMap<java.net.URL,java.lang.String> finalList)
      This method calls the getConnectionData method, performs the connection to the database using the obtained data and then inserts the url and file path into the correct column of the created database table.

      protected static void setPath(java.lang.String path)

    • Method Detail

      • getLink

        protected static java.lang.String getLink()
        Returns:
        link saved in a HashMap, ready to be copied into the database

      • setLink

        protected static void setLink(java.lang.String link)
        Parameters:
        link - the link to set

      • getPath

        protected static java.lang.String getPath()
        Returns:
        computer path which indicates the computer location where the .html file of the examined link is saved

      • setPath

        protected static void setPath(java.lang.String path)
        Parameters:
        path - the path to set

      • getConnectionData

        private static void getConnectionData()
        This method's purpose is to ask the user of this app all the necessary information such as the Local database path or the log-in data in order to perform a connection to the database.

      • insertData

        protected void insertData(java.util.HashMap<java.net.URL,java.lang.String> finalList)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method calls the getConnectionData method, performs the connection to the database using the obtained data and then inserts the url and file path into the correct column of the created database table.
        Parameters:
        finalList - a HashMap in which all the examined urls and their computer paths are saved
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getDatabasePath

        private static java.lang.String getDatabasePath()
        Method which helps to get (in a graphic way) the right database path using regular expressions to check the path and if-else blocks to handle any possible errors.
        Returns:
        the path of the local database

      • getUsername

        private static java.lang.String getUsername()
        Method which helps to get (in a graphic way) the username of the user using if-else blocks to handle any possible errors.
        Returns:
        the username in order to log in to the database

      • getPassword

        private static java.lang.String getPassword()
        Method which helps to get (in a graphic way) the password of the user using if-else blocks to handle any possible errors.
        Returns:
        the password in order to log in to the database

      • getTableName

        private static java.lang.String getTableName()
        Method which helps to get (in a graphic way) the table's name using if-else blocks to handle any possible errors.
        Returns:
        the name of the table in which we want to put the results
